text: @ADHDdesigner Theres an ad on tv at the moment that uses a Christmas song adapted to advertise summer beach holidays. Every time I get the song out of my head, I see the ad again. It is driving me wild. 😫
@KatyBenson20 @FazalShort I know NTs who take this view. I married one 😂

@galaxysleeps This is terrible and I'm so sorry. 

(Q not for the OP who has dealt with enough - what is PEM?)
@VryKranky Thanks x

@VryKranky I've been in a level of burnout since a big meltdown in November. Now my partner has had enough. So my whole life + stability is about to be broken apart (but I dont know when -for various reasons we have to stick it out for a while), and I am not ok. But it's not ok to be not ok
Not sure how much more stress hurt and pressure I can take. I'm trying to hold it together for my kids but I'm cracking. No amount of mindfulness or self care is going to fix this.

@AutieAdorableMC I was given the option to do the developmental hx myself if there was noone suitable. As it is my mum has filled a form with her version, and I'm going to do the interview. It's useful to know stuff like did she drink pregnant but Its my experience that counts.

@AnnMemmott I love swimming but I find busy public sessions too much. Quiet midweek sessions when you almost have the pool to yourself ideal. Used to love the uni pool in the summer when barely anyone was there.
@laurenancona I saw these and thought of your post... (a little brighter than the pastels you're rocking!) https://t.co/x7tyJX1ydk

@AnLasair Thanks for posting this. I'm basically down to my last chance to save my relationship (of 7 yrs and 3 kids) that has nosedived since I realised I'm ND. I don't think it will "cure me" I see it as a phrase book that might get me thru t most difficult convos without a meltdown. 🤞
@commaficionado Its addictive! Have you watched "Race the world" on BBC iplayer? It was what got me through the first lockdown.
@SNeurotypicals Its not looking very hopeful right no :(
@SNeurotypicals Every interaction with my partner at the moment 😔
@JayR_Xx Florida man pretending to be a cop pulls over real deputy, sheriff's office says
@LitMoose I have no idea what's going on atop that pizza
My world has literally crashed around my ears but due to circumstances I have to pretend like everything is fine. It is not fine. Sitting on the edge of a panic attack and no where to turn.
@exceedhergrasp1 Butterfly rash? Lupus?
@iSmashFizzle https://t.co/XLS0yyiXsX
@mud_and_stars Only just figured out that I might be autistic, and I'm feeling this big time. 😔

A really rubbish RSD/PMT/mylifeisactuallyfallingapart day. So stuck+ sad+ lonely. Figuring out my ND might save my MH in the long run (I hope) but i dont think it'll make anything better in time to save my marriage. No friends to talk to abt this. Terrified of losing my kids.
@iputahexonyou Totally relating to this. Nothing I am is right right now. I'm the same person but burnout has ripped my mask off and now I'm scared I'm losing my family.
Is it really "anxiety" if you're having a reaction to things going to shit all around?
@ItsEmilyKaty Wow! You're having one heck of a day! Glad you're back on the horse!
@BootstrapCook Turned ours off. Only putting it on once on morning and only if really cold after that. Socks, slippers and jumpers abound.

@BinitaKane My 2.5yo seems to have less energy and tires more easily than before. We had ?beta in October 2020, and  my wife had omicron in december 21, my son didnt test positive but was ill thru that time. I wonder how many kids have sx dismissed as "growing pains" or laziness??
@OMGImAutisticAF My (NT) wife once said an enthusiastic Hi! To someone she recognised.... it was Pierce Brosnan. https://t.co/mfczgh8L4i

Decision paralysis... my wife's 40th, and I got 2 cards. One reminds me of our honeymoon, and one I thought was cool, but isnt very romantic. We've been having a tough time, I think she doesnt love me anymore. I can't decide which to give her, and no idea what to write. https://t.co/sxtALNeN49
@BelindaMcfayden @fibonacci_rocks On the hunt for an ND therapist as we speak...
@justltho Wishing joy your way https://t.co/ozReSttNzI

@NotTypical12 I get this from time to time. The most memorable was when we moved house and the name of the removal company was on boxes everywhere and then got stuck in my head on rapid repeat for months and months 😫
@proyearner I've just realised I did this with Mrs Crimble's Coconut Macaroons... just had one and yuck! But I used to eat them by the packet!!

@fibonacci_rocks Most recent episode I framed as AuDHD burnout not depression, took a different approach (identifying + reducing sensory stuff, identifying emotional dysregulation + using calming techniques) and I've got better quicker. while still recovering, I've been much more functional 3/end

@fibonacci_rocks I've tried all the antidepressants; now on one that can be used in treatment of ADHD 🤔. Therapy helped but I've always got stuck at "so what do I do about it", i have difficulty understanding some theories and feel lk theres sth wrong with me for not being able to go further 2/

@fibonacci_rocks I believe this is my experience. I've had several depression "episodes" since age 16 each after a particularly difficult emotional, sensory or traumatic event. Each time it's like a bit of my ability to cope wih every day life is lost or not meeting the complexity of the time
1/
@DrRJChapman Hermeneutical... love that word. Gonna try to use it today. Once I figure out what it means (I have an idea but wouldnt want to mis-use it now would I!)
@jessejanderson Wait... you read my report cards? From 30 years ago?!

@lifeinautism Yes, I'm always trying to make things better, make constructive complaints to the right people and stand up for the people who cant, but then end up taking on too much and not being as effective as I would want.
RT @scubadaphne: Shame on you Gatwick airport - the irony of being told to "be patient "by an assistance worker whilst waiting by this sign…

@ADHDJobs I also have a tendency towards a social justice 'take' on my own situation; if I'm discriminated against or experience obstacles then others will who aren't as able to stand up so I have a habit of being the one to call it out and try to improve things... with mixed impact on me!

@ADHDJobs At the moment I'm self diagnosed. I'm seeking diagnosis so i might be able to get access to work support as my job gets more complex and busy. I'm in a sector that shouldn't discriminate (not that any should) but I dont think theres enough understanding. 2/3

@ADHDJobs I might not disclose at interview, but I have disclosed to my managers at work now. One has been really supportive (and has been for MH stuff before), the other one is like "well you've managed well before, I'm sure you'll be fine" despite me explaining current extra challenges

@LeslyeRFolmar @ADHDJobs Seriously, who can make eye contact in a zoom anyway, everyone is looking at their screen, not into their camera. For me it's a benefit of digital working. If they're calling you out for no eye contact, its abelist BS.

@GiftedNotBroken This is all very new, only really just realised I'm autistic, only recognising the episodes I've had in the past were meltdowns. Terrified of hurting people further. No idea really how to take the actions you've suggested. 😞

What do you do when you realise you've been horrendous to someone you love when overwhelmed/melting down? But to leave and eliminate the risk of doing it again would cause more damage/trauma? I'm feeling trapped and ashamed and i have nowhere to turn #AskingAutistics

Paralysed by personal emotional dysregulation + existential fear related to international events. Getting no work done; feeling worse for that. Need to clear some stressors from my life but again that's not work stuff so feel guilty for using work time to do it. #ADHD #autistic
@ADHDdesigner I forget to look at to do lists
@snarkbat https://t.co/qnlZgh6FlU

@ADHDdesigner @dreamsofskies I'm struggling to pick up books I'm part way through, even though they're really good. I know my MH is better when I've got a weaving or crochet project on the go but cannot motivate myself to pick those up even tho they're much better to do watching tv than scrolling twitter!
@LeylsTurk I currently can't go LTFT as I'm paying of a massive erroneous overpayment. Pretty sure payroll dont I understand the part they play in (undermining) the mental wellbeing of NHS staff
@NataliaADHD @AletheaAllen I'm going to give it a try! Thank you!

@AletheaAllen I hate how much I nag my 3.5yo likely Au/ADHD to sit still w eating dinner. Hes fallen off his chair 2many times fidgeting, if we let him run round the table he spreads food all over. Yet to find a compromise that let's him move but keeps house in reasonable state. Ideas welcome!

@Saraheboon @commaficionado My 3.5yo already does at nursery, then melts down @ home. Nursery have been really open to our concerns and are helping him unmask there so hopefully he won't sustain too much damage. Now I must do better shouting less when he runs headlong into his sister etc (running is a stim)
@doctor_oxford @10DowningStreet B&M have them for 1.99 but even that is too much if you're trying to decide if eating or protecting your family is more important on an inadequate wage. 😞
@FrostFire425 @professor_dave @GoodLawProject ?

#AskingAutistics #ActuallyAutistic How good is the ADOS at picking up #Autism in intelligent highly masked women? All the lit I can find was tested in men and one paper that looked at women too implied it was less reliable for them. Dont want my dx missed due to "high funcion"
@DrDavidWarriner Wow. As an F1 I was surprised if a consultant knew my name, let alone my phone number!
@autismsupsoc I'm a doctor. I have had friends (just rubbish at keeping them!). I fit in (highly malleable masker who adapted  to everyone else to the point of not recognising myself)

@scribecheck Yes... to the point that I've questioned whether I'm actually autistic or just believing my wife who suggested it. (I have lots of traits when pointed out but I forget them when faced with an assessment questionnaire!) Ironic (I think).

Filling out an #autism self assessment - asks me if I do things "appropriately" (make eye contact, interact with peers). Appropriate to whom, what context?! If I don't do it appropriately am I inappropriate?! Worried about how the org doing the assmnt will view 30+ yrs of masking
@csdriver @CountBinface Oh so no need then.
@CovIam @CountBinface And everything in it will die...
@yvettedoc50 Steering well clear of book and series. Far too close. 😔

@JayR_Xx In the UK only psychiatrists can start ADHD meds. only when you've reached a constant dose and need no more "tweaking" can the GP take on prescribing the repeat scripts. It can take several years to get to see an ADHD psychiatrist, then months  between assessment and getting meds

@BootstrapCook You are awesome Jack. Thank you for all you do. Any tips for feeding a vegetarian family of 5 that includes 2 coeliac and 3 fussy toddlers? Even my "small shop" came to £100 despite 2 supermarkets and a lot of effort to only buy what we needed.

@ADHDdesigner My mum hears any discussion of my neurodivergance as an accusation of neglect. Shes didnt have a clue what was going on for me much of the time at all. If everything "looked fine" it was. When it wasn't fine she'd not know what to do and make it about her. 🤦‍♀️
@social_parasite Well done. I've had a similar day of changes of plan, lack of routine and intermittent upset, and I've been an absolute shouty nightmare all day. :(
@commaficionado I successfully named most of the countries bordering the correct one... but not the correct one itself

RT @Jodieinfinity: @mitdasein I'm gonna pop some tags 
Only got stim toys in my pocket 
Bright lights, I'm hating
Clothes shopping is awful

#actuallyadhd #ADHD UK tweeps please sign!!
Petition: Review management of ADHD assessments and increase funding https://t.co/ibw8owJCrV

I spend 90% of the time I'm with my wife worrying that I'm exhausting. We have 3 young children who *are* exhausting and shes getting less and less tolerant of my #ADHD-ish ways... thanks random Twitter person for confirming my fears. Self discovery is a dbl edged sword it seems.

@fodderfigure Well I'm kinda in meltdown and I yelled at my kids to "eat all the fucking cake" (in response to recurrent requests) - then my (also ND) 3.5yo asked me if he could have "all the fucking cake" so he could eat it as instructed.. profane autism seems to be an accurate diagnosis.

All I want right now is to sit in a comfy chair, in a quiet warm sunlit garden listening to the breeze and the birds, with a cup of coffee and a gooey, chewy sweet cinnamon swirl.
And not be coeliac or beholden to the incessant needs of my three young children (just for a bit)

#AskingAutistics #ActuallyAutistic 
What adult over ear noise cancelling headsets do you rate?
I dont want to play music I literally need some silence without the tinnitus that in-ear buds give me.
(Tho I do need a decent work mic/headphones set too) #sensoryoverwhelm #autism
@ItsEmilyKaty Just tweeted this... then googled and found your tweet. It makes sense, and why I get so so stressed when trying to restrict snacking. Hm.
@Peston So many people missing that this spelling is a word of latin origin that actually has use other than as an americanism of something else!!

#AskingAutistics #ActuallyAutistic 
Is eating a stim? Cause seriously I cant sit still to do this piece of work (#actuallyadhd too), I'm annoying myself and feeling overwhelmed after 3 solid hours of annoying meetings this morning and I.just.cant.stop.eating!

@autienelle Realising I dont just forget to brush my teeth because #ADHD but also cos the vibrations in my skull from my electric tb are unbearable if I'm even slightly on edge. Dissociation+++ needed for yearly visit to the hygienist, then being shamed 4 not being able to do daily torture!

Return to wrk mtg with supervisor. Surprise! she doesnt really understand #neurodiversity, or that changes in my life mean I cant "just muddle through + succeed" as I always have, or that the masking and effort needed for that is the problem. #actuallyadhd #ActuallyAutistic
@commaficionado All of the above at least once in each. Apart from 40+ as I'm not 40 yet.
@ADHDdesigner In the North West here. Referred in May 2021. Recently told I stil have a year to 18 months to wait. :(

@GarakRobinson @ItsEmilyKaty I can relate. So much stuff pushed down over so many years. Realising I'm ND is like a door has been opened to the room where all the good and bad *feeling* has been stored. Just working out what to make of it and how not to wreck my marriage in the meantime!

@MrsMummypennyUK My dad-in-law died, his inheritance paid the deposit. Wish it weren't so he was 59 and never met his grandkids. My wife and I were in late 30s, over average wages and still a HUGE mortgage to pay

@Lewis100Anita @Laracapybara @jaydbint It was the lower limit of the unit. likely there due to bed issues in the med wards. Prob should have been in cardiology as the thing that might have saved her was a big dose of fruosemide :( she was waiting for cardio r/v. it was my 2nd job after ortho  I was pretty clueless.
@BigBaldDr @AnnaHalfpenny7 @jaydbint Level 5 is when you have a mental breakdown and quit

@CarlaCruella @jaydbint Shouting "someone sort the f@£king airway" while trying to lead the arrest and do chest compressions while 3 nurses stand around looking for direction. Hindsight is a good teacher but I never made it to try again.

@jaydbint The only 1 i had in F1 was f@*king horrendous. 2 F1s just back on the ward from lunch, first and only medics on scene. The nurses all followed our "lead" which was disastrous. Consultant sat in office totally unaware/unbothered (elderly care, the pt was 65, she died). No debrief.

@MissBethanEJohn I barely eat any bread these days. I luckily get bread on prescription but tbh my son who's intolerant (inconclusive test, dont want to retest just yet) eats most of it. It's so depressing having such limited options - I have 3 reliable takeaway options and I'm sick of them all!!

When you're so #ADHD that you totally think the enormous toblerone you found under the seat in your car was a forgotten treat-to-myself (win!!) And totally don't consider that it might have been a badly-hidden valentines gift from your other half...

@NeuroRebel Figuring out my ND (ADHD and Autism) at 37. Life's been a series of success, crash as things got more complex, picked myself up, figured how to mask differently + repeat. Now I'm at max complexity - 3 kids, moving towards consultant post + I'm done. I cant live that way any more.

@divergentdawn What's worst is finding one that's ok, buying  every colour every yr for 12 yrs, then the store shuts down + all the bras you own break in t next 3 months. I have yet to find anything that's comfortable and its terrible!!
@social_parasite Though the noise really doesnt help!!

#askADHD #AskingAutistics 

Currently on NHS waiting lists for both #ADHD and #Autism assessments. I'm struggling with work and considering going private to speed things up... can probably only afford one or the other. Which would be more useful???
@commaficionado Mine was always actually lost. #ADHD
Saving for when I have time/headspace to read, or when I get one on me to binge-read it all! https://t.co/Dp6gHGjRWp
@the_tweedy When you say the word clout a lot it sounds funny

1st day back at work after 4 months off. Made it to 2pm without too much major procrastination... now I'm stuck. #ADHD #autistic inertia?
It's time for a walk.
@emgntdivergence I'd give my kids a reward for waking up at 6am. I'd be a lot less grumpy than when they wake up at 4.45am.
@social_parasite I have 3 degrees. I had to get my wife to help me fill out an #autism form.
Is a preponderance for puns a #neurodivergant thing? (I feel I should include a pun in this tweet but my bird-brain fails me)
@the_tweedy @Sayree78 Is this like "stick a fork in me, I'm done"?
